intro: Siphonanthus rotundifolius, commonly known as the round-leaved siphonanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing a drought-resistant adaptation. Its small, pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat. The species is noted for its compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated for its ecological and horticultural benefits.
